verses.plain: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

tokens.t: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;

verses.plain: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;

tokens.t: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom,
apply thine heart to understanding;

verses.plain: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;

tokens.t: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge,
liftest up thy voice for understanding;

verses.plain: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;

tokens.t: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as
hid treasures;

verses.plain: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.

tokens.t: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the
, and find the knowledge of God.

verses.plain: For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.

tokens.t: For the
giveth wisdom: out of his mouth
knowledge and understanding.

verses.plain: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

tokens.t: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous:
a buckler to them that walk uprightly.

verses.plain: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.

tokens.t: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.

verses.plain: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.

tokens.t: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity;
, every good path.

verses.plain: ¶ When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;

tokens.t: ¶ When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;

verses.plain: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:

tokens.t: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:

verses.plain: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;

tokens.t: To deliver thee from the way of the evil
, from the man that speaketh froward things;

verses.plain: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

tokens.t: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

verses.plain: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

tokens.t: Who rejoice to do evil,
delight in the frowardness of the wicked;

verses.plain: Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:

tokens.t: Whose ways
crooked, and
froward in their paths:

verses.plain: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;

tokens.t: To deliver thee from the strange woman,
from the stranger
flattereth with her words;

verses.plain: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.

tokens.t: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.

verses.plain: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.

tokens.t: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.

verses.plain: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

tokens.t: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.

verses.plain: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.

tokens.t: That thou mayest walk in the way of good
, and keep the paths of the righteous.

verses.plain: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

tokens.t: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.

verses.plain: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.

tokens.t: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
